com.googlecode.sarasvati.rubric.env
Class DefaultRubricEnv

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.sarasvati.rubric.env.DefaultRubricEnv
All Implemented Interfaces:
RubricEnv
public class DefaultRubricEnv
extends Object
implements RubricEnv

Basic RubricEnv implementation which uses a RubricFunctionRepository as a source for predicate and date function and which uses Calendar to do relative date evaluations. Business days/hours are not handled differently then regular relative dates.

Author:
Paul Lorenz

evalRelativeDate

public Date evalRelativeDate(Date date,
                             boolean business,
                             int offset,
                             int unit)
Description copied from interface: RubricEnv
Calculates a date, offset by the given amount to the passed in date. The units parameter will correspond to one of
  • Calendar.HOUR
  • Calendar.DATE
  • Calendar.WEEK_OF_YEAR
      How the date calculation is done is up to the implementing class. A simple implementation would map on to Calendar.add(int, int). A more complicated implementation might take business days or other business rules into account.

      Specified by:
      evalRelativeDate in interface RubricEnv
      Parameters:
      date - The date to calculate the offset from
      business - Indicates whether the calculation should takes busines days/hours etc into account.
      offset - The amount of the offset.
      unit - The unit of the offset. These map the units defined in Calendar, such as Calendar.DATE or Calendar.WEEK_OF_YEAR.
      Returns:
      The offset relative to the given date.
